com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui

Class GuiControllerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.GuiControllerBuilder

  • public class GuiControllerBuilder
extends Object
    The class GuiControllerBuilder is used for building a GuiController. Depending on the functionality you want to provide you have to implement different interfaces. If you want to support all Acrolinx Plug-in features use withAllCommands(AboutCommandCallback, HelpCommandCallback) . After calling all wanted with-methods call build() for building a GuiController. Use GuiFactory.guiCheckControllers() for creating this object.

      Adds an about button to the toolbar and menu with the possibility to plug in your customized about dialog.
      GuiControllerBuilder withAllCommands(AboutCommandCallback aboutCommandCallback, HelpCommandCallback helpCommandCallback)
      With all commands.
      GuiControllerBuilder withCheckInline()
      Call this method if you want to have a check button on your toolbar or menu bar.
      GuiControllerBuilder withCheckWithCorrectionDialog()
      With check with corrections dialog command.
      GuiControllerBuilder withGuiUpdateListenerContext(GuiUpdateListenerContext guiUpdateListenerContext)
      If you have to deal with several GuiController you could use a GuiUpdateListenerContext, created by GuiFactory.guiUpdateListenersContexts(), to synchronize the updates.

      With help command.

      • withGuiUpdateListenerContext

        public GuiControllerBuilder withGuiUpdateListenerContext(GuiUpdateListenerContext guiUpdateListenerContext)
        If you have to deal with several GuiController you could use a GuiUpdateListenerContext, created by GuiFactory.guiUpdateListenersContexts(), to synchronize the updates. Normally one GuiController should be enough. You also could create several synchronized tool bars and menus.
        Note:If the GUI controlled by this GuiController becomes invalid, you have to unregister this GuiController by calling GuiUpdateListenerContext.unregister(GuiUpdateListener). The GuiController is automatically registered at GuiUpdateListenerContext while build().
        Parameters:
        guiUpdateListenerContext - The GuiUpdateListenerContext where you want to register the new GuiController.
        Returns:
        The GuiControllerBuilder itself for chaining
